flying_direct.title: Flying Direct to Valencia
flying_direct.p1: There are currently no direct flights from the U.S. to Valencia. Most routes will require at least two connections — one at a major international hub (such as New York, Atlanta, or Chicago), and another at a European airport (like Madrid, Frankfurt, or Paris).
flying_direct.p2: Keep in mind that layovers can be long, and you'll likely pass through border control at your first point of entry into the Schengen area.
flying_direct.p3: We would recommend booking flights through websites such as Skyscanner.

major_airport.title: Flying to a Major Spanish Airport
major_airport.p1: If you're flying from the U.S., you may find it easier to fly into a major Spanish city and continue on to Valencia from there. If you have a bit of time, consider spending a couple of days in Madrid or Barcelona — both are fantastic cities — before making your way to Valencia. Below are some options:

madrid.title: Flying into Madrid
madrid.p1: You can fly directly to Madrid from several major U.S. cities. From Madrid to Valencia, you have a few convenient options:
madrid.train: Train: The high-speed AVE train connects the city centers and takes just under 2 hours. We recommend booking tickets via Trainline.
madrid.flight: Flight: There are multiple daily flights from Madrid to Valencia (approx. 1 hour), though the train is usually faster and more comfortable.
madrid.bus: Bus: Buses take around 4.5 hours and can be a budget-friendly option. You can book these through Trainline.
madrid.driving: Driving: If you're renting a car, the drive from Madrid to Valencia takes about 3 hours.

barcelona.title: Flying into Barcelona
barcelona.p1: Barcelona is another great option, with direct flights from many U.S. cities. From Barcelona to Valencia:
barcelona.train: Train: Comfortable trains between the city centers take just under 3 hours. Book via Trainline.
barcelona.flight: Flights take about 1 hour, though the train is often the more convenient choice.
barcelona.bus: The bus ride takes around 4.5 hours and is typically more affordable, especially if booked early.
barcelona.driving: Renting a car? The drive from Barcelona to Valencia is around 3.5 hours.
